definition: report a success/announce a victory
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
Czech/Czech Republic/abbr. for 捷克[Jie2 ke4]
variant of 捷[jie2]/quick/nimble
victory/triumph/quick/nimble/prompt

sentences.english: Wellington went to the village of Waterloo to draw up his report to Lord Bathurst.
sentences.chinese: 威灵顿回到滑铁卢村里写军书，向贵人巴塞司特报捷。

sentences.english: The pig had good news to, Kam rats send spring.
sentences.chinese: 金猪报捷去，锦鼠送春来。

definition: report of success/report of a victory
to report a heroic deed/to mention sb in dispatches
to request recognition for sb's merits/to recommend sb for promotion or an award
to withdraw troops from the front/to return in triumph
notification/memorial
issue a decree
to congratulate respectfully/to express good wishes
to request help/to appeal (for assistance)
to spur the horse to full speed (idiom)/to go as fast as possible
messenger/courier
to win/to be victorious/to report a victory
to serve the king diligently/to save the country in times of danger/to send troops to rescue the king
to circulate (a protest or call to arms)/to promulgate
to notify/to inform
to follow up a victory/to pursue retreating enemy
promotion to the nobility (idiom)
